title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.11-12 | 04-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: So was Dwarka protected by the descendants of Vrishni, Bhoja, Madhu, Dasharha, Arha, Kukkura, Andhaka, etc., who were as strong as Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 11th verse of the 11th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, describing the protection of Dwarka by the Vrishni dynasty.

segments.key_quote: The city of Dwarka was well protected by the descendants of Vrishni who were as powerful as the Lord insofar as he manifested his strength upon this earth
segments.summary: The speaker explains Srila Prabhupada's purport on the 11th verse, comparing Dwarka's protection to Nagloka and discussing the extent of Lord Krishna's manifested power.

segments.key_quote: The city of Dwarka puri was filled with opulences of all seasons there were hermitages orchards flower gardens parks and reservoirs of water breeding lotus flowers all over
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains the 12th verse, describing the opulence and natural beauty of Dwarka, contrasting it with modern cities.

segments.key_quote: Advancement of civilization is estimated not on the growth of mills and factories to deteriorate the finer instincts of the human being.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the natural opulence of Dwarka with the problems of modern industrial civilization, highlighting the deterioration of human instincts due to factories and slums.

segments.key_quote: And such activities deteriorate the finer sentiments of the human being and society to form a dungeon of demons.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses 'ugra karma' (pungent activities) and its connection to demoniac nature, contrasting it with the spiritual atmosphere of Dwarka.

segments.key_quote: In the modern civilization, such impious trees are planted on the sides of trees. You can see all over in the city.
segments.summary: The speaker differentiates between pious and impious trees, criticizing the planting of only impious trees in modern cities.

segments.key_quote: Krishna not only teaches by instructing us but also manifesting the ideal atmosphere, ideal development which he demonstrated in Dwarka.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of developing finer senses for spiritual understanding, utilizing nature's gifts, and highlights Dwarka as an ideal civilization demonstrated by Krishna.
